CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A person whose rights are violated by a public authority through an administrative act or through the failure to examine a request within the statutory period , is entitled to obtain the recognition of the right claimed , the annulment of the act and compensation for damage .

CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ Section CARDINAL . Liability of the ORG for damage caused by the actions of the criminal investigation organs , prosecution and courts

( CARDINAL ) Damage caused to a natural person through illegal conviction , illegal prosecution , illegal application of preventive measures in the form of detention on remand or of a written undertaking not to leave the city , and illegal subjection to the administrative sanction of arrest or of non - remunerated community work , is to be fully compensated by the ORG , whether or not officers in the criminal investigation organs , the prosecution or judges were at fault . ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Law No . DATE on compensation for damage caused by the illegal acts of the criminal investigation organs , prosecution and courts read as follows :
“ Section CARDINAL
( CARDINAL ) In accordance with the present law , individuals and legal entities are entitled to compensation for the moral and pecuniary damage caused as a result of :

d ) carrying out of unlawful investigative measures ;

( CARDINAL ) The damage caused shall be fully compensated , irrespective of the degree of fault of the criminal investigation organs , prosecution and courts .
